EVONIK CORPORATION RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



INTRODUCTION AND BACKGROUND

Evonik Corporation's (EC) accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures and management practices.  All applicable procedures of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Prevention Program are adhered to.  

The Evonik Corporation Hopewell plant has a long-standing commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in safety and environmental protection, employee safety training and safety in the design installation, operation and maintenance of plant equipment.  Evonik has implemented reasonable controls to prevent and mitigate probable releases of highly hazardous chemicals.



DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCES AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

Evonik Corporation Hopewell plant is a specialty chemicals production facility located at 914 E. Randolph Road in Hopewell, Virginia.  The plant is situated on approximately 40 acres on the east side of Hopewell in the industrial section of the city.  



Organic surfactants and esters have been manufactured at the Evonik Hopewell site since 1982, with an organo-modified silicones production facility added in 1991.  The Hopewell Polyether Plant (HPE-1) produces specialty polyethers and began operation in 2004.  The site employs approximately 130 employees at the Randolph Road site and is operated 24 hours a day, seven days a week.



Evonik Corporation produces organic surfactants, organo-modified silicones and polyethers at the Hopewell, Virginia facility.  As defined by the regulations, the Hopewell facility stores the following Highly Hazardous Chemicals (HHC's) in excess of the threshold quantities: 

1. Ethylene Oxide (CAS # 75-21-8), Maximum storage capacity =  198,414 pounds.

2. Propylene Oxide (CAS # 75-56-9), Maximum storage capacity = 198,414 pounds.

3. Allyl Alcohol (CAS # 107-18-6), Maximum storage capacity = 99,207 pounds. 



The HHC

's are utilized in the HPE-1 production facility to produce specialty polyethers that are used primarily as a raw material in the production of organo-modified silicones.



RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

The general Evonik accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:

High level of training of the operators

Mechanical Integrity program

Use of state-of-the-art process and control equipment

Use of accurate and effective operating procedures

Process Hazard Analysis 

Compliance with the OSHA Process Safety Management Program



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

This facility has been in operation since 03/17/2004 and has had no accidents.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Evonik has an Integrated Release Response Plan that is coordinated with the City of Hopewell Emergency Plan. The Evonik emergency response plan is tailored to the facility and emergency response services available in the community and is in compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.  The plant has emergency communication capabilities not only with telephones but also through the Hopewell Emergency Network system of radio communication with local emergency, industry and educational facilities.
